json_schema.description: Credit notes are official legal documents used to notify your customer that credit is being applied.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

number.description: A unique, sequential code that identifies the document. Legally, a credit note number sequence should never contain repeats or gaps. Automatic numbering is used by default.

issue_date.description: The date when the credit was issued.

related_document.description: On credit notes that cancel out an invoice, the related invoice.

due_date.description: The date on which payment for this document is due.

tag_list.description: Multiple tags should be separated by commas.

anyOf.description: Any customer or vendor who appears on your invoices, credit notes, and expenses.

contact_person.description: If the contact is a `company`, this is its contact person.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

department.description: If the contact is a `company`, this is the deparment.

first_name.description: The contact's first name. Only if the contact is a `person`.

language.description: The contact's preferred language. 2-letter [ISO language code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes). Should be included in the account's translations list.

last_name.description: The contact's last name. Only if the contact is a `person`.

notes.example: Some private notes about the contact.

processor.description: The external platform where the contact was imported from, if applicable.

processor_id.description: The ID the `payment_processor` assigned to the contact.

permalink.description: The URL for the hosted billing area, where customers can download their invoices and update their billing details.

tax_id.description: The contact's tax identification number. Quaderno can validate EU VAT numbers, ABN, and NZBN.

tax_status.description: Specifies the tax status of the contact.

postal_code.description: The customer’s billing ZIP or postal code.

street_line_1.description: The customer’s billing address line 1 (Street address/PO Box).

subject.description: An optional summary description of the document.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

subtotal_cents.description: Gross price before any discount or tax is applied.

discount_cents.description: Current discount applied, if there is one.

discount_rate.description: Discount percent out of 100, if applicable.

quantity.description: Quantity of the product being invoiced.

product_code.description: The SKU of the Quaderno `Product` being invoiced. Use this attribute if you want to track your sales per product.

tax_1_name.description: Name of the tax, if applicable

tax_1_rate.description: Rate of the tax, if applicable

tax_1_region.description: Tax region, if applicable. Only for US sales tax and Canada GST.

tax_2_name.description: Additional name of the tax, if applicable

tax_2_rate.description: Additional rate of the tax, if applicable

tax_2_region.description: Additional tax region, if applicable. Only for US sales tax and Canada GST.

total_amount.description: The total amount to be charged after discounts and taxes. Required if `unit_price` is not passed.

unit_price.description: The unit price of the item before any discount or tax is applied. Required if `total_amount` is not passed.

items.description: The individual line items that make up the credit note. No more than 200 items are allowed in a request. To add more use subsequent update requests. Maximum items per document are limited up to 1000 items.
The taxes associated with the invoice.

region.description: Tax state/province. Only for US sales tax and Canada GST.

county.description: Tax county. Only for US sales tax.

taxes.description: An array of tax line objects, each of which details a tax applicable to the credit note.

items.description: The payment associated with the invoice.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

payment_processor.description: The payment processor used to process the payment.

payment_processor_id.description: The ID the `payment_processor` assigned to the payment.

payments.description: Array of all payments on this credit note, if applicable.

payment_processor.description: The payment processor used to process the credit note.

payment_processor_id.description: The ID the `payment_processor` assigned to the credit note.

custom_metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate used, if applicable, to this credit note.

subtotal_cents.description: Total of all items before any discount or tax is applied.

discount_cents.description: Current discount applied, if there is one.

state.description: The status of the credit note.

permalink.description: The URL for the hosted credit note page.

pdf.description: The URL of the PDF version of the credit note.

json_schema.description: Invoices are statements of amounts owed by a customer, and are either generated one-off, or generated periodically from a recurring.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

number.description: A unique, sequential code that identifies the invoice. Legally, an invoice number sequence should never contain repeats or gaps. Automatic numbering is used by default.

issue_date.description: The date of the invoice’s issue - not necessarily the date the products or services were provided.

related_document.description: On credit notes that cancel out an invoice, the related invoice.

due_date.description: The date on which payment for this invoice is due.

tag_list.description: Multiple tags should be separated by commas.

payment_details.description: Detailed information about the accepted payment methods.

anyOf.description: Any customer or vendor who appears on your invoices, credit notes, and expenses.

contact_person.description: If the contact is a `company`, this is its contact person.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

department.description: If the contact is a `company`, this is the deparment.

first_name.description: The contact's first name. Only if the contact is a `person`.

language.description: The contact's preferred language. 2-letter [ISO language code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes). Should be included in the account's translations list.

last_name.description: The contact's last name. Only if the contact is a `person`.

notes.example: Some private notes about the contact.

processor.description: The external platform where the contact was imported from, if applicable.

processor_id.description: The ID the `payment_processor` assigned to the contact.

permalink.description: The URL for the hosted billing area, where customers can download their invoices and update their billing details.

tax_id.description: The contact's tax identification number. Quaderno can validate EU VAT numbers, ABN, and NZBN.

tax_status.description: Specifies the tax status of the contact.

postal_code.description: The customer’s billing ZIP or postal code.

street_line_1.description: The customer’s billing address line 1 (Street address/PO Box).

subject.description: An optional summary description of the document.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

subtotal_cents.description: Gross price before any discount or tax is applied.

discount_cents.description: Current discount applied, if there is one.

discount_rate.description: Discount percent out of 100, if applicable.

quantity.description: Quantity of the product being invoiced.

product_code.description: The SKU of the Quaderno `Product` being invoiced. Use this attribute if you want to track your sales per product.

tax_1_name.description: Name of the tax, if applicable

tax_1_rate.description: Rate of the tax, if applicable

tax_1_region.description: Tax region, if applicable. Only for US sales tax and Canada GST.

tax_2_name.description: Additional name of the tax, if applicable

tax_2_rate.description: Additional rate of the tax, if applicable

tax_2_region.description: Additional tax region, if applicable. Only for US sales tax and Canada GST.

total_amount.description: The total amount to be charged after discounts and taxes. Required if `unit_price` is not passed.

unit_price.description: The unit price of the item before any discount or tax is applied. Required if `total_amount` is not passed.

items.description: The individual line items that make up the invoice. No more than 200 items are allowed in a request. To add more use subsequent update requests. Maximum items per document are limited up to 1000 items.
The taxes associated with the invoice.

region.description: Tax state/province. Only for US sales tax and Canada GST.

county.description: Tax county. Only for US sales tax.

taxes.description: An array of tax line objects, each of which details a tax applicable to the invoice.

items.description: The payment associated with the invoice.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

payment_processor.description: The payment processor used to process the payment.

payment_processor_id.description: The ID the `payment_processor` assigned to the payment.

payments.description: Array of all payments on this invoice, if applicable.

evidence.description: Evidence are proofs of customers' location that must be stored to comply with tax rules.

additional_evidence.description: Additional evidence used to proof the customer's location. Required if there's a `additional_evidence_country'.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

document_id.description: Unique identifier for the related invoice.

notes.example: Some private notes about the evidence.

payment_processor.description: The payment processor used to process the invoice.

payment_processor_id.description: The ID the `payment_processor` assigned to the invoice.

custom_metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate used, if applicable.

subtotal_cents.description: Total of all invoice items on the invoice before any discount or tax is applied.

discount_cents.description: Current discount applied, if there is one.

permalink.description: The URL for the hosted invoice page, which allows customers to view and pay an invoice.

pdf.description: The URL of the PDF version of the invoice.
